summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from January 29, 2020, discussing preparation for an interview with an Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) about human trafficking cases. The emails coordinate which cases to highlight, noting that high-profile cases like Epstein, cult/sex trafficking cases, and foreign/labor cases are not included in the initial list, which focuses on domestic cases with gang ties.

persons.name: Hubert Dupigny
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of a recent sex trafficking conviction case in Manhattan federal court, referenced via a Department of Justice link.

events.title: Planned ADIC Interview on Human Trafficking
events.description: An Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) of the FBI New York office is scheduled to give an interview for a new monthly podcast with a radio station, with the first topic being human trafficking.

keyFacts: The email chain is preparing an FBI ADIC for a podcast interview focused on human trafficking cases.
It explicitly states that high-profile cases like Epstein, cult/sex trafficking cases (referenced as 'Nexium on C-2'), and foreign/labor cases are not included in the initial list of case examples.
The initial list provided includes three recent domestic sex trafficking cases with strong gang ties, such as the conviction of Hubert Dupigny.
The correspondence indicates the FBI's Human Trafficking matters are handled by specific agents in the New York office.
The document references a desire to avoid discussing specific statistics about increases in trafficking during the interview.
